content.description: Starting moves are difficult, then easier climbing to middle of climb where the two small Crux sections are . Finishing going right to anchors.  Good hands most of the climb.
content.location: Starts on the outside left of the Dark Hollow wall.

content.description: Belay from first tier, route is furthest right on South facing wall.  1st bolt is eight ft from the ground. Climb past easy ledge to the main wall.  The Crux is at the top of the climb.
content.location: Right side of Dark Hollow wall. 15 ft left of Ichabod

content.description:
An easy, juggy start to the 4th bolt leads you up to the ten feet of crux. The use of wide stance stemming technique and you'll be home free. May feel a bit harder to a shorter climber.

* Note  - Route and trail improvements are currently underway so be aware of climbers cleaning along the trail and rock routes. Please be considerate to the developers/bolters.
content.location: Ichabod is the slab climb located on the right outside edge of the Dark Hollow wall alcove.

content.description: Belay from top tier with belayer bolt. Climb past ledge with roots, to first bolt. Longer draw will reduce rope drag on first bolt. Crux is in the middle of the climb going over the bulge. Fairly easy route staying left of the bolt line all the way to the anchors.
content.location: Left route on West facing wall. 8 ft left of Asylum.

content.description: Beautiful red/orange rock just right of the dihedral. Lots of fun, plenty of holds.  Try to stay balanced at the anchors.  Belay from top tier, with bolt for belayer or next to wall with another bolt for belayer. 1st bolt is ten foot up from ledge.
content.location: Left route on South facing wall. 8 ft left of Blitzkrieg

content.description: Belay from second tier or next to Wall.  1st bolt is on the main wall 10ft up from the ledge.  A little more shelf climbing than the typical Robinson pocket climbing makes it fun and interesting. The Crux is in the middle. Then easier climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Middle route on South facing wall. 8 ft left of Kamakazi.

content.description: In the spring the base of this route is often quite wet. In this case one might start up one of the neighbors and traverse to “The Dude” where appropriate. There is very little rope drag on this route and another great view from the top. The crux occurs going from bolt 6 to 5. Hopefully this route will became as classic as its namesake.
content.location: This Dark Hollow route lies between Big Bertha on the left and Lost Souls on the right.

content.description: The route starts up a series of dihedrals and skirts left of a large cave - not unlike “Bathtub Mary” in the Red! It then follows an arete for two bolts - probably the crux - before reaching easier climbing and the wonderful view from the top. There is a lot of rope drag on a moderate route of this length. To help minimise it we suggest using extended alpine draws on bolts 12, 10, 7 and 2 (counting from the top down).
content.location: This route is at the southern end of Dark Hollow. There is a small, battered Hackberry tree close to its start. Lots of choss rained down on this poor tree in preparing the route and, unfortunately, there is probably more to follow. Belayers beware - wear your helmet!

content.description: Belay from top tier, with belayer protection bolt. Climb past ledge to get to left part of roof. Crux is the first few moves through the left side of the roof. Stretch for the nice shelves to get past the bulge.  Small hands at top but still good holds and a god send left hand 2 finger pocket if you find it.  Really fun route.
content.location: Right route on West facing wall.

content.description: "Abandon all hope ye who enter the Dark Hollow!" Just kidding! This area is home to a handful of shorter climbs. Just past the Apache wall you'll find a small alcove. There's a small cave up in the left corner and not a lot of sun here so you'll want to visit during morning hours in the winter. The area remains shaded all summer.Please provide feedback using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
